meaningMnemonic: Think about it this way. There is a famous fishing lure inventor, working on his best work ever. He’s old, and he’s been trying to make the best fishing lure for the last 50 years, and knows this will be his last invention. Then he figures it out. He takes one <radical>barb</radical>, and connects the end of it to the top of another <radical>barb</radical>. When he does this, he knows his work is finally <kanji>finish</kanji>ed.
readingMnemonic: How does the fish lure maker test his newly <kanji>finish</kanji>ed lure out? The one he just finished? He gets in a <reading>row</reading> (りょう) boat and rows out into the sea.
